name: soho scrunchie
yarn_weight: any gauge - designed for any gauge
notes:
behold the perfect quick project to use up those precious scraps of yarn!

the soho scrunchie was named after the neighborhood in nyc that attracts fashion-forward minds & creatives alike, which felt fitting for the scrappy nature of this pattern.

this seamless scrunchie is a great way to practice provisional cast on & kitchener stitch techniques before attempting them on a bigger project.

-

**sizes**
mini (medium, jumbo)
finished circumference (without elastic): 16” / 40 cm for all sizes
finished height: 1” (2”, 3”)

**yarn** 
fingering weight: 42 (84, 126) yds / 38 (77, 115) m
sport/dk weight: 35 (70, 105) yds / 32 (64, 96) m
worsted weight: 28 (56, 84) yds / 26 (51, 77) m
bulky weight: 22 (44, 66) yds / 20 (40, 60) m

**suggested needles & notions**
fingering weight: us 4 / 3.5mm - 16” (40 cm) circular needle.
sport/dk weight: us 6 / 4mm - 16” (40 cm) circular needle.
worsted weight: us 7 / 4.5mm - 16” (40 cm) circular needle.
bulky weight: us 9 / 5.5mm - 16” (40 cm) circular needle.

additional circular needle used for provisional cast on stitches.
waste yarn and crochet hook for provisional cast on, hair elastic, tapestry needle, scissors.

**gauge**
fingering weight: 24 sts x 32 rounds = 4” / 10 cm
sport/dk weight: 21 sts x 28 rounds = 4” / 10 cm
worsted weight: 18 sts x 24 rounds = 4” / 10 cm
bulky weight: 15 sts x 20 rounds = 4” / 10 cm
